availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Taylor W. Samuels (Nelson County farmer and distiller)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer and distiller. Kentucky native. Married to Lavinia Osburn on January 2, 1845. Father of William Samuels, Thomas Samuels, Robert Beamis Samuels, Mary Catherine Samuels, and John Samuels. Founded a commercial distillery in Deatsville, Kentucky, in 1844. Farmer in Nelson County in 1850 and 1860. Sheriff in Nelson County.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 215.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Precinct 9, p. 57A-57B.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, File #000481488, Nelson County, January 2, 1845 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky, Birth Records, 1847-1911, Nelson County, January 7, 1853 (accessed via ancestry.com).
John C. Tramazzo, _ Bourbon and Bullets: True Stories of Whiskey, War, and Military Service_ (Lincoln, NE: Patomac Books, 2018), 6.
